item.title: Star Wars Unlimited: Comprehensive Rules
item.description: Welcome to the comprehensive rules for Star Wars Unlimited, a strategic card game set in the Star Wars universe. In this game, players build decks around iconic characters and locations, battling for galactic supremacy through tactical gameplay and powerful card combinations. Version: 2.0 (Last updated: June 21, 2024) Game Overview linkStar Wars Unlimited is a dynamic card game that pits two or more players against each other in epic battles across the Star Wars galaxy.

item.title: Card Types
item.description: General linkA card’s type is located in the top left corner of the card. There are 6 different types of cards: bases, events, leaders, units, upgrades, and tokens. A “resource” is not a type of card, but a game object that a card becomes when placed in the resource zone. Base link Represents a location in Star Wars. Has a name, trait(s), HP value, and aspect icon. Some bases also have an ability.

item.title: Abilities and Effects
item.description: Abilities and effects are core components of Star Wars Unlimited, defining how cards interact with each other and impact the game state. This section provides a comprehensive overview of the different types of abilities and effects, their resolution, and timing considerations. Table of Contents link General Types of Abilities Effects Resolving Abilities and Effects Timing and Triggers General linkAn ability is specialized game text that indicates how a card affects the game.

item.title: Setup and Victory
item.description: Star Wars Unlimited: Two-Player Constructed Formats linkThis section covers the rules for two-player constructed formats in Star Wars Unlimited, including game setup and victory conditions. General Rules link Star Wars Unlimited can be played using several different game formats, defined by player count and deckbuilding method. A “constructed” deckbuilding format is any format in which players build decks ahead of time from cards in their collection. Unless otherwise specified, all rules in the Comprehensive Rules apply to all constructed formats.

item.title: Keywords
item.description: Keywords are card abilities indicated by bold red text that have specific associated rules. This guide covers all keywords in Star Wars Unlimited and their detailed mechanics. General Rules link Keywords resolve automatically unless specified otherwise. Cards can gain keywords as constant abilities or lasting effects. Multiple instances of the same keyword generally do not stack, with some exceptions. notifications For more details on keyword interactions, see the [Glossary](glossary.md) and [Abilities and Effects](abilities-and-effects.

item.title: Game Concepts
item.description: Overview linkThis section covers the fundamental concepts and rules for Star Wars Unlimited. Understanding these core mechanics is essential for gameplay. General Concepts link Star Wars Unlimited is typically a two-player card game, with optional multiplayer rules. Players need one deck each, an initiative counter, damage counters, and token cards. Deck size varies by format, with specific requirements for leaders, bases, and other cards. Leaders and bases are part of a deck for deckbuilding but separate during gameplay.

item.title: Turn Structure
item.description: Turn Structure in Star Wars Unlimited linkUnderstanding the turn structure is crucial for mastering Star Wars Unlimited. This section provides a comprehensive overview of how each game round unfolds, from setup to victory. A solid grasp of turn structure will help you plan your strategies and make the most of each action. 1. Game Overview linkA game of Star Wars Unlimited consists of multiple rounds, each divided into two main phases: the Action Phase and the Regroup Phase.

item.title: Game Zones
item.description: Overview linkGame zones are defined areas in Star Wars Unlimited with specific rules. Understanding these zones is crucial for gameplay. This section covers the seven different types of zones and their characteristics. Types of Zones link Base Zone Ground Arena Space Arena Resource Zone Deck Hand Discard Pile The ground and space arenas are shared between players, while the other zones are separate for each player. Base Zone link Located in the center of each player’s play area Contains the player’s base and leader at the start of the game Bases always remain in this zone Leaders move between this zone and the ground arena Ground Arena link Shared zone located next to each player’s base zone Contains ground units Units face their controller when ready Ground units can attack enemy ground units and the enemy base Space Arena link Shared zone located next to each player’s base zone Contains space units Units face their controller when ready Space units can attack enemy space units and the enemy base Resource Zone link Each player has their own resource zone Contains facedown cards called “resources” Resources can be exhausted to pay costs Players can add one card from their hand to this zone during each regroup phase Deck link Each player’s deck is its own zone Cards are facedown and out of play by default Cards leave the deck when drawn, discarded, or played directly Hand link Each player’s hand is a private zone No limit on the number of cards in hand Cards in hand are hidden information from opponents The number of cards in hand is open information Discard Pile link Each player’s discard pile is its own zone Contains faceup cards that have been played, defeated, or discarded Open information that can be viewed by any player Order of cards does not need to be maintained Additional Concepts linkIn-Play and Out-of-Play Zones link In-play zones: Base Zone, Ground Arena, Space Arena, Resource Zone Out-of-play zones: Deck, Hand, Discard Pile Play Area link Consists of cards a player controls in in-play zones Excludes upgrades controlled by a player but attached to enemy units Set Aside/No Zone link Cards set aside are out-of-play and not in any zone Token cards begin set aside and enter play through abilities For more detailed information on card interactions within and between zones, refer to the Glossary and other sections of the comprehensive rules.

item.title: Player Actions
item.description: Player Actions in Star Wars Unlimited linkUnderstanding player actions is crucial for mastering Star Wars Unlimited. This section provides detailed explanations and timing charts for the core actions: Play a Card, Attack With a Unit, and Use an Action Ability. info For each type of action, perform each step in order and as completely as possible. Resolve any triggered abilities between steps before proceeding. Play A Card linkGeneral Rules link A player follows these steps when they choose to take the Play a Card action on their turn, or when they resolve an ability that lets them play a card as a nested action.

item.title: Multiplayer Rules
item.description: Multiplayer Rules linkThis section covers the rules for playing Star Wars Unlimited with more than two players. General Rules link Star Wars Unlimited can be played with three or more players using multiplayer formats. Multiplayer games can use decks created with either constructed or limited rules. Unless specified otherwise, all rules in the Comprehensive Rules apply to multiplayer formats. item.description: A linkAction Ability linkAn ability indicated by the word “Action” that a player can use as their action for the turn. See Abilities and Effects Active Player linkThe player currently taking an action. See Turn Structure Ambush linkA keyword that allows a unit to ready and attack when played. See Keywords (Related: Ready) Arena linkA shared zone where units are played. There are two arenas: ground and space. See Game Zones (Related: Ground Arena, Space Arena)
